page.title: 16LOCAL ROAD NAMES IN GRAYS
page.content: {PALMER'S AVENUE} Named after William Palmer, a local pioneer in education upon whose endowment Palmer's School for Boys and Palmer's School for Girls were founded. {NUNN'S WAY} Named after Rev. Nunn (a lovely old man) who was the vicar of a small Church of England church which used to be in College Road. {TURP'S CORNER} This is the local name for the junction of Rectory Road and Chadwell Road. There used to be a farm at the N.E.corner of the junction owned by a Mr.Turp. A Miss Turp, daughter of the farmer, was Headmistress of the Infant School in Rectory Road.
